description: WE'RE LIVE! Join the most professional & fan-favorite streamer to explore Terra! Live stream mishaps? Not a chance!

tags.name: VTuber
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is either an actual or fictive VTuber.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

title.native: アークナイツ 黎明前奏

alternative: エンシオディスシルバーアッシュ

node.description:
[Website](https://www.hypergryph.com/)

Hypergryph Network Technology Co. Ltd., commonly known as Hypergryph or HG, is a video game development company based in Shanghai, China. It is known as the creator and developer of Arknights and the publisher of the game's original Chinese version. It was founded on January 24, 2017 by Hai Mao and his colleagues from Google, Cygames and MICA Team (now [Sunborn](https://anilist.co/studio/6593/SUNBORN-Network-Technology)), the latter of which is notable for being the developer of [Girls' Frontline](https://anilist.co/anime/128828/Dolls-Frontline/). Hypergryph consists of several subsidiaries such as the development teams for their games or their own label Monster Siren Records for the music related to Arknights.

(Source: Arknights Wikia, edited)

[Website](http://www.aokijun.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aokijun) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/aokijunmovie/)

Born 1981 in Okinawa, Japan
2000 Graduated from Okinawa prefectural High School and moved to Tokyo
2002 Enrolled in the Department of Design, Tokyo University of the Arts
2003 Started making independent animation films with a class assignment
In September of the same year, while working on his own projects, he formed TACOROOM, a video production team made up of five of his classmates. (dissolved in 2007)
2007 Graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts, Department of Design

(Source: aokijun.net)
Yifeng Huang is the current CEO of Hypergryph.

[Weibo](https://www.weibo.com/lowlight) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/904187)

Hai Mao, known by the Global community of Arknights as Lowlight, is the founder of [Hypergryph](https://anilist.co/staff/282347/Hypergryph), currently serving as its Vice President and the Head Producer of Arknights.

Hai Mao graduated from China Academy of Art. During his college days, Hai Mao was actively involved in various doujin circles and primarily made those related to Touhou Project, in which he was an ardent fan of. He also loves doujins made by other artists who later became part of Hypergryph, notably Huanxiang Yutu and NoriZC. It was during this period that Hai Mao befriended [Zhong Yu](https://anilist.co/staff/266087/Zhong-Yu) who would later found MICA Team (now [Sunborn](https://anilist.co/studio/6593/SUNBORN-Network-Technology)) of the Girls' Frontline fame where Hai Mao himself would be part of.

In 2017, Hai Mao left MICA/Sunborn and ended his friendship with Zhong Yu. He and some of his remaining friends then went on to found Hypergryph and developed Arknights.

(Source: Arknights Wikia, edited)

[Website](http://liltasm.com/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/LILtasm)

Asami Ike is a 2011 graduate of Tokyo University of the Arts, Faculty of Fine Arts, Department of Design. She is also a 2013 graduate of the university's Graduate School of Film and New Media, Department of Animation. Her works have been screened in animation festivals in Japan and abroad. Ike’s art is based on cutesy mascot characters but her films are often ethereal in tone.

(Source: MAL)
